byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Jess Bidgood, Christina Capecchi, Natalie Pita and Nate Schweber.

abstract: Women across United States say Hillary Clinton's nomination as Democratic Party's presidential candidate is step closer to unprecedented progress for women in country; question of how electing a female president would materially affect lives of women in country has become more concrete with Clinton's nomination, and many say female presidency would likely be palpable positive force in their lives.
lead_paragraph: In interviews, women across the country said they believed that a female presidency could be a force in their own lives, even if they did not yet know how.

headline.main: In Hillary Clinton’s Nomination, Women See a Collective Step Up
headline.print_headline: After 240 Years, Women See a Female President Lifting Them All

snippet: In interviews, women across the country said they believed that a female presidency could be a force in their own lives, even if they did not yet know how....
